original: Öberg, Thure Ferdinand, civilingenjör, direktör, Huskvarna, f. 30/3/93 i Vännäs, Västerb. 1., av kyrkoh., teol. dr Ferdinand Ö. o. Emilia Axberg. G. 20 m. Helfrid Krook. Barn: Birgit f. 21, g. m. civ:jägm<. Gunnar Wistedt, Margareta 24, Lars Olov 26. — Stud:-ex. i Umeå 14, KTH (E) 15-19. Lab:-ing. v. ASEA i Ludvika 19-24, verkst:- ing. o. assist, åt verkst :chefen där 24-34, övering. o. driftchef v. Konfektions A-B Junex i Huskvarna 34-42, tekn. dir. v. Norrahammars Bruk 42-46, verkst. dir. i Husqvarna Vapen-fabr. A-B sed. 46. Lär. v. Ludvika stads lärl:- o. yrkessk. 20-34, sakk. i 38 års unif :koimm., övering. i försv:-väs. verkst :nd 40-41, chef f. ind:-komm. textilsekt. konfektionsbyrå 41-42, led. av 42 års mil. reparationstj :-utredn., led. av Ludvika folksk :stvr. 31-34, kyrkofullm. 32-34, ordf. i Huskvarna nykterh :nd, v. ordf. i verkstyr. 38-42, ordf. i styr. f. Jönköp. 1. centr. yrkessk. 48, led. av il. komm. utredn. o. ko’mim. samt av ett flert. bolags- o. fören:styr. Medl. av Sv. tekn :fören.. Frimurarorden, Par Bricole, Rotarykl. m. fl. fören. o. sällsk. Skr.: art. i tidn. o. tidskr. RVOlkl.
translated: Öberg, Thure Ferdinand, civil engineer, director, Huskvarna, b. 30/3/93 in Vännäs, Västerbotten. Son of clergyman, theologian Dr. Ferdinand Ö. and Emilia Axberg. Married on 20th with Helfrid Krook. Children: Birgit b. 21, married to civil forester Gunnar Wistedt, Margareta b. 24, Lars Olov b. 26. Completed high school in Umeå in 1914, studied at Royal Institute of Technology (E) from 1915-1919. Laboratory engineer at ASEA in Ludvika from 1919-1924, executive engineer and assistant to the director there from 1924-1934. Chief engineer and operations manager at Konfektions A-B Junex in Huskvarna from 1934-1942, technical director at Norrahammars Bruk from 1942-1946, executive director at Husqvarna Vapenfabrik AB since 1946. Teacher at Ludvika trade and vocational school from 1920-1934, expert in a 38-year uniform commission, chief engineer at the defense administration's manufacturing board from 1940-1941, head of the industrial commission textile sector clothing office from 1941-1942, member of the military repair service investigation of 1942, member of Ludvika elementary school board from 1931-1934, church representative from 1932-1934, chairman of Huskvarna temperance alliance, vice chairman of the board from 1938-1942, chairman of the board for Jönköping County Central Vocational School in 1948, member of several company and association boards and committees. Member of Swedish Engineering Association, Freemasonry Order, Par Bricole, Rotary Club, and other organizations and societies. Published articles in newspapers and magazines. Awarded the Royal Order of the Polar Star.

structured.name: Thure Ferdinand Öberg
